transcript.text: [Tense music]

[In a French accent]
You're gonna be scared.

You're all definitely addicted to 
videos about horror, paranormal stories, etc.
You like not to sleep and hurt yourselves!
You really like to suffer, you weirdos!
Listen!
After being harassed by a lot of people,

I decided to make a new horror video.
[laughs]
I was actually not harassed, but hijacked.
You took me in hostage, really!
You threatened me!
Calm down!

There are not always 
scary things to tell, so I take my time.

The last 2 or 3 horror videos, 
I related everything from the "Let's Not Meet" Subreddit

on where people talk about strange things 
and real stories that happened to them.

Today, we're going back 
to the previous format Twitter threads.
We started all this with Twitter threads.
You remember that?
We go back to sources with a new...
..French thread!
Oui oui oui oui oui!
And I find this one amazing!
Let's read @el_gatera's thread
- let's call him Michael in order to follow the story easier.

In the end, we're all going to visit 
dark forums to know more about it,
'cause we're all gonna shit our pants!

Michael tells that he recently brought 
a trunk from his basement
to use it as a decorative item.
He says "everything's normal, y'all would say".
And I already disagree with him!

Don't bring a one-century trunk
 from your basement
to decorate you room!
That doesn't sound a good plan!

He explains that it recently 
started to make noise.

The fucking trunk.
That's really not meant to decorate.

He says he's sure that 
there are noises coming from inside of it
as weird as it sounds.
Opening it directly would be so easy,

Michael specifies that it has a padlock,
but nobody has the key.
Fine.

Noise out of a one-century trunk 
coming from his basement
and nobody has the key.
Great!
He describes it and says it is 3,39ft long

it's very old, probably dates 
from pre-war period.
This is a very old object.
Some minutes later,

Michael hears another noise 
from inside the trunk.

The noise would sound like a combination of
hitting, cracking and nails scratching.
None of these noises are reassuring. None!
Michael managed to sleep anyway.

He added he fell asleep 
as soon as the noises stopped.
That's all for the bases, now let's move on the story,

that lasts for days, because he wrote 
tweets almost everyday on this story
that degenerated quickly!
Next day, he says he slept well
and goes back on what he said

and explains that there is no padlock,
but a keyhole instead.

Hey, Michael, it's not important,
tell us about the trunk, what is it for?
He posts a picture, the trunk looks like that.
Nothing surprising, it's a casual trunk.
There are two keyholes:

one is locked, the other seems 
to have been forced.

He highlights a point:
why has only one keyhole been forced?
Why does the person has stopped?

People tell Michael 
"try to record the noise coming from the trunk,

so that we can help to find 
a rational explanation together,
so that you'll stop shitting your pant."

Michael has an idea: 
he activates the dictaphone app

and puts the phone 
all night long next to the trunk
and check the recording on next day
to find this noise he heard many times.

Michael wakes up at 11:30am, 
that bastard makes us wait!
He says he had a party last night,
but it worked, he recorded three hours.

I know, you're disappointed, 
so am I, but it stopped after 3 hours.

But he managed to record 
hitting and cracking noises
that we can hear with a loud sound.
Let's hear that!
[hitting]
[little scratch]
The scratching makes me feel queasy!
Maybe there's a cut finger inside doing like
That's horrible.
Michael, we love you and have a good time,
but now grab a hammer or a crowbar
and hit it to open it!
Please!

[Twitter whistling]
"That's the only hammer I have, don't judge me"
Thank you!
You should've done it earlier, but it's ok.
He opens the trunk, and what's inside is...
..papers.
Are you disappointed? I am too.
Few hours later, he has more information.

He spent this time figuring out 
all the content of this trunk.

There was old papers: 
notes, postcards, draws, etc.
They're a bit wiped because of the time.
And three items.

He opens the first one, 
takes photos and shares them with us.
It is a book with a hole within the cover,

a glass with a sort of red object inside
 that we can barely see, it's not clear.

The second one is an old clock, 
and a candle in a bowl.

What's weird for the third one 
is that it was put in a box covered in lead.

Obviously, everybody wants him 
to open this box
to see what's inside.

That's what he does, 
and what's inside is incomprehensible.
There's a little flask laid on salt

in which there's an object 
hung by apparently a hair.

And everything is sealed 
with a sort of metal sheet around.

This is the most mysterious object 
we have seen so far.
Under the salt, there's a picture of fishes.
[laughs] Man.
How many questions do we have now?

Where does this trunk come from?
What's its story?

Why is it here?
Ask your parents, I don't know.
That's what he does, he calls his dad

who tells him that this trunk 
belonged to his great-grandfather.
That sounds credible,

because we often find in basements 
things that date from 1 or 2 generations ago.

Things that are passed 
from generation to generation.

But those are not haunted things 
like Micheal's seems to be... [laughs]

And Micheal's great-grandfather 
was in the army, so he traveled a lot.

It would explain why there are 
so much postcards, notes and others in this trunk.

So, we have 3 elements, 
and we don't know what these are.
Now, Twitter users are going to do research

to bring information to Michael 
and find out what are all these.
First, someone recognized the book cover.

It would be a book from 1886 called
"Le monde avant la création de l'homme"
written by Camille Flammarion.

It would be a big book 
that gathers 9,000 prints.

And people tell Michael 
that a box covered in lead isn't that unusual.

It is often used in witchcraft
 to confine an entity.
Yes.

The guy has a relic 
of the Warren couple in his house.
And he opened it!
He says he doesn't believe in all this.
He doesn't believe in witchcraft, etc.

But he admits that the salt 
makes him think of a spell.
To sum up, the first object is a book,
the second with the lead box,
but the one with the clock and the candle
we still don't know.

From now, no news from Michael 
until early evening.
He says something creepy happened to him.
He says he went shopping
and on way back, someone followed him.

Ok... Maybe you're paranoid 
because you opened a haunted thing?
Maybe?

Is it the entity you just set free 
by opening this damn trunk?

Maybe?
[laughs]
I'm happy not to have a trunk in my basement!
I feel great!

Once at the door, he looked back 
to check the guy who followed him

and he immediately looked away,
pretending to be on his phone.
Just like anybody caught in the act.
So Michael warned people, by saying

"we all have theories 
and try to figure out what's going on,

but I don't want this to invade my privacy,
so don't make jokes, that's not fun.
If someone knows my address, that's not funny."

To sum up, he said stop 
to anybody who went too far in this story.

But this was a bit before 
receiving a creepy PM on Twitter.

The next day, 
he got a PM on Twitter from an account called
"Est eriam nuper as tergum".
It sounds latin.
Latin is a bit like the candle and the clock
it's part of the "NO" elements!
We don't want that!

This account sent him a video 
and the text "333"
at 3:33am.
The video has shitty quality

but we understand what's on it:
someone recorded Michael through his window.

Michael instantly answered him 
"I don't know if you hear me shithead,
but next time, I'll call the cops."
Michael suspects a friend of his joking around

given that his thread became famous 
with 1,700 retweets.

We all have friends who go to far, 
some messing dudes.
But he find this not funny

and the sentence in latin means
"it's to late to go back."

If I was Michael, 
I'd put everything back in the trunk

I'd burn it and move abroad.
[laughs]

In the meantime, someone explains that 3:33am
means "the Devil's hour" and refers to Satan.

This person specifies that he/she ignores 
if it's linked or intentional
anyway, he/she says it,
makes Michael crying inside, and leaves.

At this time, the frontier between 
deads and alives would be tenuous.

It would open the door 
to spiteful entities such as demons or ghosts.
This contrasts 3:33pm, "the divine invitation"

that would be the time 
Jesus died on his cross.
Ok.

Another person who claims 
to be satanic asks Michael

if the smell of the candle 
reminds him of something familiar.
He says that it indeed smells sulfur.
According to the satanic, it would mean

that maybe somebody invoked an entity, 
because sulfur is related to invocations.
I don't know anything about that,
its makes me feel bad, I don't want to know.

Whether true or false, I don't want to know, 
it freaks me out, that's dreadful.

The guy adds that when a witch 
makes a deal with the Devil

he/she gets so much powerful, 
in return of this power

he/she must waive baptem 
and submit his/her soul forever.

This famous "deal with the Devil", 
that occurs in countless movies.

Once the deal is made, 
Satan would be connected
and he/she must obey temporarily.

In the meantime, 
he would be locked in objects such as...
..trunks!

Anyway, you all got it: 
everyone tells Michael about witchcraft,
there are evidence all along:

salt, sulfur smell, 
the candle, the blocked clock...

After all, Michael had a good night, 
because there were no noises.
Things seem to have settled down.
Until the next day,

after midnight he hears someone
knocking on his window repeatedly.

He decides to go out and to record, 
so that he can show to the police.

Remember that he said he would 
call the cops if it happened again.
This is the case now.
Just see by yourself.
[breathes heavily]
A dude with a hood who seemed to flee,

but after seeing Michael chasing him, 
he decided to turn back and run to him.

Don't worry, he's fine. 
He reached home before getting caught
and locked his door.

It's too much, he decides 
to see the cops the next day.

Next day, because he doesn't want 
to go out all alone.

He feels reassured when 
there are people around, he feels paranoid.
Bad news.

The cops only told Michael 
that they can't do anything for him.

The cops can't react 
to a video of someone running to you.

They'll just say "if you got more elements, 
come back and we'll help,
but for now, it's not enough."
In the afternoon, he goes visiting a priest.
It was time for it!

But one hour later, he says 
the priest is an incompetent, 'cause he said:
"Come and pray tonight, God'll protect you."

I'm agnostic, so I don't know 
anything about religion.

But did you want the priest to do?
[laughs]

You want him to change your door lock?
 What else could he have said?

The next day, the bad news follows 
on from one another.
We're close to the end of the thread.
Michael says he can't sleep,

that all this story has an impact 
on his mental health.

He would have talked to himself, 
while he never do that.

He also looked for the source of 
a rotten-fish smell in his studio.

Latin.
I'm boring, but really,

latin, the clock, the candle, 
the rotten-fish smell...
Run away!

He finally decides to spend 
some days to a friend of his.
He's got a bad idea too:

taking with him the items a
nd papers he found.

You haunted yourself, 
now it's your friend's turn. Nice!

He says "If what I think is correct, 
then I'll need all these."
What's on his mind?

I don't know it, and we won't have 
any news for the next 48 hours.

But he finally give news, 
and first says that he feels better.
He "made most of the calm to rest,
clear the situation."
He thanks everybody who gave information
and who tried to help him.

Each discussion he had 
with each person was helpful.

It feels like he got the problem, but don't say 
too much, because it could be dangerous.

He admits he's made a mistake: 
opening this damn trunk.

According to him, it's not just about 
closing the trunk with everything in it,

but the problem is somewhere else, 
it's something quite old
and that it's up to his great-grandfather.

100 years later, he can never 
find out what was happened,

but thanks to the postcards, 
he can deduce where it happened.

We've got no news since 6 days 
at the time of the video.

His last words were:
"I have to fix the mistakes of my ancestor,
I must put the packages back."

"I can't tell you more, I'm scared of 
giving information to bad people."

"I don't know who they are, but I don't want 
to risk my life because of a tweet."

"Don't worry, I'll keep you posted 
on the story and my research."
It was 6 days ago!

Michael! Are you okay?
Are you in the trunk now?

Scratching the side like that 
to scare the next owner?
Damn!

Friends, this is the end of the thread
 at the time of the video.
No end is not that bad.

It's been a while that we didn't read a thread
around Devil, religion, cults, witches...
I wanted to read it, because, after making horror videos,
I received lots of emails of people
talking about weird things that happened to them
around religion.

During their childhood, 
like upside down cross,
I got a lot of these.
Horror movies that make me uncomfortable
are those related to religion.
I feel bad, uncomfortable, that's too much!

Plus, I don't know anything about it,
 so I can't reassure myself.
I just shit my pant and scream "ah"!
I liked this thread, hope to read the end.

I don't know when, 
but I'll post the link to it in the infobar,
so that you can follow the thread.
Have all a good night!

If you have a trunk, then let it 
in the basement and never bring it out,
so you'll have a good night.
See you in a next video, bye bye, see you!
[outro]
